decks.notes: This deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes cards that provide value when entering the battlefield and support the aggressive strategy. The key idea is to have a strong early game presence and maintain it with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler for disruption and Heliod, Sun-Crowned for additional power. The deck also runs removal spells and enchantments to control the board and protect its creatures. Yorion, Sky Nomad is included as a companion for additional value and flexibility in longer games.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of small, efficient creatures and controlling spells. Using cards like Reflector Mage and Stasis Snare to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also having a steady stream of creatures to apply pressure. The inclusion of Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Walking Ballista provide additional win conditions and ways to generate advantage. With the support of cards like Baffling End and Teferi, Time Raveler to keep the opponent on their back foot, this deck aims to quickly establish board control and close out the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and pump spells to quickly pressure and overwhelm the opponent. By including Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion, the deck maximizes damage output by only including odd-converted mana cost cards. With efficient ramp creatures like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Steel Leaf Champion and Lovestruck Beast while also having removal options like Bonecrusher Giant and Crater's Claws. The Great Henge provides additional card draw and life gain, while cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Klothys, God of Destiny provide additional utility and resilience.

This deck focuses on utilizing auras to quickly buff up creatures and create a powerful aggro strategy. By enchanting creatures with cards like Cartouche of Solidarity, All That Glitters, and Ethereal Armor, the goal is to create powerful, hard-to-deal-with threats on the battlefield. Additionally, cards like Karametra's Blessing and Sram, Senior Edificer provide protection and card draw to keep the pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds extra value by allowing for recursion of important auras and creatures.

Utilizing small creatures and powerful enchantments, this deck focuses on quickly building up a single creature to become an unstoppable force. By using Auras to enhance the creature's power and protect it, along with cards that provide card draw and resilience, the strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a highly efficient threat. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck is able to continually recur valuable pieces from the graveyard, ensuring a steady stream of resources and resilience.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of various removal spells, hand disruption, enchantments that provide recurring value, and a companion that allows for extra card advantage. It aims to outvalue the opponent by maintaining board control, disrupting their game plan, and utilizing powerful enchantments like Demonic Pact and Doom Foretold to gain incremental advantages. With a mix of removal, card draw, and threats that can generate card advantage, the deck seeks to grind out the opponent and eventually overwhelm them with its synergistic pieces.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on early game aggression with low cost spells and creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Key cards like Lightning Strike, Boros Charm, and Lurrus of the Dream-Den provide extra damage and versatility. The deck aims to control the board with burn spells and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while maintaining card advantage with Light Up the Stage. The mana base is optimized for consistent early game aggression with a mix of red and white sources.

This deck focuses on playing small, aggressive creatures and equipping them with powerful Auras to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Sentinel's Eyes, Ethereal Armor, and All That Glitters, the creatures can become huge threats early in the game. The deck also includes ways to protect and recur the Auras, such as Karametra's Blessing and Lurrus of the Dream-Den. By combining aggressive creatures with powerful Auras and protective spells, this deck aims to quickly deal damage and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the aggro strategy to quickly overwhelm the opponent with auras that boost creature abilities and provide protection. By combining powerful auras like Sentinel's Eyes, Ethereal Armor, and All That Glitters with creatures like Favored Hoplite and Aphemia, the deck aims to create a fast and aggressive board presence. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion, while cards like Sram, Senior Edificer and Hateful Eidolon provide card draw and additional benefits when casting auras.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost creatures and utilizing Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx for mana ramp. The key strategy involves generating incremental advantage through lifegain and token generation, supported by removal spells like Stasis Snare and Baffling End to control the opponent's board. Heliod, Sun-Crowned serves as a primary win condition, providing additional power to creatures and enabling the deck to maintain pressure. The inclusion of Gideon planeswalkers adds flexibility and resilience to the deck's game plan, while Tomik, Distinguished Advokist aids in disrupting opponent's strategies.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around using various counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to control the pace of the game and prevent the opponent from mounting a strong offense. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to provide additional control options and card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds a unique twist to the deck, providing additional utility and synergies with the rest of the cards. Overall, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient control tactics.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to combo off and win the game efficiently. By utilizing cards like Underworld Breach and Pore Over the Pages, the deck can dig deep into the library and find the necessary pieces to create a powerful combo. The inclusion of Fae of Wishes allows for additional flexibility and options to search for key cards in the sideboard, while cards like Hidden Strings and Vizier of Tumbling Sands help to untap Lotus Field and generate even more mana.

The deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent's life total. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion amplifies the damage output of odd-costed cards. With cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Ghitu Lavarunner putting pressure on early game, supported by burn spells like Wild Slash and Wizard's Lightning, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The creature choices, such as Boros Reckoner and Bonecrusher Giant, provide additional threats and disruption to control the board.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on low-cost, efficient spells and creatures to deal damage quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value through recurring low-cost permanents. The deck aims to utilize cheap burn spells like Wild Slash, Shock, and Lightning Strike along with efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Runaway Steam-Kin, and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure and close out games. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, ensuring the deck can consistently deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on a control strategy that aims to control the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck also includes cards that provide card advantage and help to stabilize the board. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allows the player to have access to more cards in their starting hand, providing additional value throughout the game. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for the spells in the deck, ensuring consistency in casting powerful spells and dominating the game.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Thoughtseize to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck runs a diverse array of threats and answers, including removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, as well as card advantage engines like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Ashiok, Nightmare Muse. With the additional value from Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to grind out opponents through attrition and outmaneuver them with its versatile range of threats and answers.
